question: Complete the sentence. When considering agile development, Architecture to Support Project will identify what products the Enterprise needs, the boundary of the products, and what constraints a product owner has; this defines the Enterprise’s ______________.
Who is responsible for the oversight of structures and mechanisms that drive enterprise governance of information and technology (EGIT)?
COBIT defines stakeholder value creation as which of the following?
options: Realization of benefits at a controlled resource cost while controlling risk
Realization of benefits at an optimal resource cost while optimizing risk
Realization of benefits at a reduced resource cost while mitigating risk

question: The value that I&T delivers should be:
options: aligned directly with the values on which the business is focused.
focused exclusively on I&T investments that generate financial benefits.
restricted to maintaining and increasing value derived from existing I&T investments.

question: COBIT addresses governance issues by doing which of the following?
options: Grouping relevant governance components into objectives that can be managed to a required capability level
Providing a full description of the entire IT environment within an enterprise
Defining specific governance strategies and processes to implement in specific situations

question: Which of the following is a guiding principle in the development of COBIT?
options: COBIT aligns with other related and relevant I&T standards, frameworks and regulations
COBIT includes relevant content from other related I&T standards, frameworks and regulations.
COBIT serves as a comprehensive standalone framework that covers all relevant I&T-related activities.

question: Which of the following is an element of governance?
options: Building plans to align with the direction set by the governance body
Monitoring activities designed to achieve enterprise objectives
Evaluating stakeholder needs to determine enterprise objectives

question: In most cases, management of the enterprise is the responsibility of:
Which of the following benefits derived from the use of COBIT is PRIMARILY associated with an external stakeholder?
options: COBIT provides guidance on how to organize and monitor the performance of I&T across the enterprise.
COBIT helps to manage the dependency on the use of external service providers.
COBIT helps to ensure compliance with applicable rules and regulations.

question: The primary target audience for COBIT is:
options: anyone responsible for the governance solution.
assurance professionals responsible for evaluating and reporting on the existence of internal controls.
business and IT management responsible for building and deploying I&T solutions.

question: Within the principles for a governance system, the value generated from the use of I&T reflects:
options: the ratio of costs versus achieved service levels.
a balance among benefits, risk and resources.
maximized financial benefits to the investment portfolio.

question: Which of the following should be addressed as an integral part of the implementation life cycle?
The maturity and capability concepts are introduced in COBIT 2019 for better alignment with?
What may happen when considering a larger number of design factors when designing a governance system?
options: Some of design workflow steps or substeps may result in conflicting guidance
The overall cost of design may increase
The time of the governance system design may increase

question: At which stage of governance system design current I&T related issues should be considered?
options: Stage 1: Understand the enterprise context and strategy
Stage 2. Determine the initial scope of the governance system
Stage 3: Refine the scope of the governance system

question: Where is the desire to change of executive management outlined?
Which of the following is an example of I&T related issues?
options: IT investment decision making, portfolio definition and maintenance.
Inability to exploit new technologies or innovate using I&T.
Optimization of internal business process functionality.

question: Role of IT and Compliance Requirements are examples of?
What are the four dimensions of the Balanced Scorecard?
How many domains of Governance and Management is COBIT core model composed of?
Which of the following are based on generic components but are tailored for a specific purpose or context within a focus area?
The enterprise goal titled `Optimization of Business Process Costs` is aligned to which balanced scorecard (BSC) dimension?
What is the focus of an enterprise that has a cost leadership strategy design factor?
Within the COBIT goals cascade, stakeholder drivers are transformed into:
Which of the following MUST be defined before determining alignment goals?
The alignment goal titled "Delivery of programs on time, on budget and meeting requirements and quality standards" is part of which IT balanced scorecard (BSC) dimension?
Which of the following would be an appropriate metric associated with an enterprise goal of `Business service continuity and availability`?
options: Satisfaction levels of board and executive management with business process capabilities
Ratio of significant incidents that were not identified in risk assessments vs. total incidents
Number of business processing hours lost due to unplanned service interruptions

question: Which of the following enterprise goals is within the Customer dimension of the IT balanced scorecard?
options: Delivery of programs on time and on budget

question: Which of the following cascades to enterprise goals?
Which of the following metrics would BEST enable an enterprise to evaluate an alignment goal specifically related to security of information and privacy?
options: Ratio and extent of erroneous business decisions in which erroneous I&T-related information was a key factor
Number of critical business processes supported by up-to-date infrastructure and applications
Number of confidentiality incidents causing financial loss, business disruption or public embarrassment.

question: Which of the following would be an appropriate metric to align with a goal of `Delivery of programs on time, on budget, and meeting requirements and quality standards`?
options: Percent of stakeholders satisfied with program/project quality
Percent of business staff satisfied that IT service delivery meets agreed service levels
Level of user satisfaction with the quality and availability of I&T-related management information

question: The alignment goal `Delivery of I&T services in line with business requirements` is organized into which IT balanced scorecard (BSC) dimension?
Which of the following management objectives is related to optimization of system performance?
Which of the following is MOST important to providing trust in operations, confidence in the achievement of enterprise objectives, and an adequate understanding of residual risk?
options: A continuity of operations response plan
A managed system of internal controls

question: Which of the following BEST describes the `managed innovation` management objective of the COBIT core model?
options: Optimize available IT capabilities to support the IT strategy and roadmap.
Achieve competitive advantage, improve customer experience and improve operational effectiveness.
Support the digital transformation strategy of the organization and deliver the desired value.

question: Which of the following is CRITICAL to ensuring I&T-related decisions are aligned with the enterprise's strategies and objectives?
options: Compliance with legal, contractual and regulatory requirements is confirmed.
Technology and innovation processes are overseen by the board.
Assurance on controls is obtained from independent IT auditors.

question: Which of the following best describes COBIT?
options: COBIT is a framework for the governance and management of enterprise information and technology.
COBIT is a full description of the whole IT environment of an enterprise.
COBIT is a framework to organize business processes.

question: Which of the following is INCORRECT regarding Enterprise Governance of Information and Technology?
options: Exercised by the board that oversees the definition and implementation of processes, structures and relational mechanisms.
The organization's CIO is accountable for the Enterprise Governance of Information and Technology
Enables both business and IT people to execute their responsibilities in support of business/IT alignment.

question: "Provides guidance on how to organize and monitor performance of I&T across the enterprise" is associated with which of the following internal stakeholders?
Management ensures that:
options: IT plans, builds, runs and monitors activities, in alignment with the direction set by the governance body, to achieve the enterprise objectives.
Stakeholder needs, conditions and options are evaluated to determine balanced, agreed-on enterprise objectives.
Direction is set through prioritization and decision making.

question: Which of the following is INCORRECT regarding COBIT and other standards and frameworks?
options: COBIT only focuses on standards and does not consider other frameworks or best practices
COBIT does not copy the contents of these related standards.
COBIT provides equivalent statements or references to related guidance.

question: Which COBIT 2019 Publication explores factors that can influence governance and includes a workflow for planning a tailored governance system for the enterprise?
options: The COBIT 2019 Framework: Governance and Management Objectives

question: What is the primary difference between Governance System Principles and Governance Framework Principles?
options: Governance System Principles focus on stakeholder needs while Governance Framework Principles focus on Information and Technology (I&T) needs.
Governance System Principles and Governance Framework Principles are the same thing in COBIT 2019.
Governance System Principles describe the core requirements for a governance system while Governance Framework Principles focus on building that governance system.

question: "A governance system should be customized to the enterprise's needs, using a set of design factors as parameters to customize and prioritize the governance system components" is an example of which Governance System Principle?
A governance or management objective always relates to _____ and a series of related components of other types to help achieve the objective.
Which of the following is NOT a component of the governance system?
_______________ are factors that can influence the design of an enterprise's governance system and position it for success in the use of I&T.
Which of the following is a design factor for a governance system that supports prioritization of management objectives based on prioritization of enterprise goals?
In the "Role of IT" Design factor, which of the following describes a STRATEGIC IT role?
options: IT is critical for both running and innovating the organization's business processes and services.
When IT fails, there is an immediate impact on the running and continuity of the business processes and services. However, IT is not seen as a driver for innovating business processes and services.
IT is not crucial for the running and continuity of the business process and services, nor for their innovation.

question: Which of the following describes the correct sequence in the goals cascade?
options: Stakeholder drivers and needs, enterprise goals, alignment goals, governance and management objectives
Where are we now, where do we want to be, how do we get there, how do we keep the momentum

question: Which of the following is NOT CORRECT regarding Governance and Management Objectives?
options: A governance or management objective always relates to one process and a series of related components of other types to help achieve the objective.
A governance objective relates to a governance process, while a management objective relates to a governance component.
Governance processes typically are under the accountability of boards and executive management; management processes are the domain of senior and middle management.

question: Which of the following is a Management Domain?

"An organized set of practices and activities to achieve certain objectives and produce a set of outputs that support achievement of overall IT-related goals" is a description of which of the following?
More information and detailed guidance on how to use the design factors for designing a governance system can be found in the ___________ publication.
Governance ________ are factors that, individually and collectively, contribute to the good operations of the enterprise's governance system over I&T and were known as enablers in COBIT 5.
Which two levels of involvement does COBIT 2019 identify within the updated RACI chart?

Which Governance or Management Objective has the following purpose statement? "Realize defined project outcomes and reduce the risk of unexpected delays, costs and value erosion by improving communications to and involvement of business and end users. Ensure the value and quality of project deliverables and maximize their contribution to the defined programs and investment portfolio."

Which Governance or Management Objective has the following purpose statement? "Achieve competitive advantage, business innovation, improved customer experience, and improved operational effectiveness and efficiency by exploiting I&T developments and emerging technologies."
Within the COBIT Goals Cascade, under which Balanced Scorecard dimension would you find the Enterprise Goal "Managed digital transformation programs?"
How many Governance and Management Objectives are in the COBIT Core?
The Goals Cascade uses _______ relationships to describe the connection between enterprise goals, alignment goals and governance and management objectives.
The Management Objective, Managed Vendors is part of which Management Domain?
The Management Objective, Managed Problems is part of which Management Domain?
Which of the following is NOT a role or organizational structure defined in the context of COBIT 2019?
Which of the following is a key principle to COBIT Performance Management (CPM)?
options: The CPM should include 5 levels of capability and maturity.
Assessing performance should be completed at the governance component level only.
The CPM should support different types of assessments.

question: COBIT 2019 Performance management supports which industry-based process capability scheme?
options: COBIT has its own capability scheme and does not support any industry-based frameworks.
Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA).

question: When rating capability levels, less formal methods often include which of the following range of ratings based on COBIT Performance Management suggestions?
A rating of FULLY indicates which of the following?
options: The capability level is achieved for more than 85 percent.
The capability level is achieved between 15 percent and 50 percent.
The capability level is achieved less than 15 percent.

question: Which process capability level indicates that the process achieves its purpose, is well defined, and its performance is (quantitatively) measured?
Which of the following includes good practices for organizational structures that can be used to assess performance of this component?

Designing a tailored governance system will result in recommendations for prioritizing governance and management objectives or related governance system components, for ____________, or for adopting specific variants of a governance system component.
options: documenting the most appropriate accountabilities and responsibilities

question: Which of the following is the correct set of steps in the governance system design workflow?
options: Understand the enterprise context and strategy; Determine the initial scope of the governance system; Refine the scope of the governance system; Conclude the governance system design.
What are the drivers; Where are we now; Where to we want to be; What needs to be done; How do we get there; Did we get there; How do we keep the momentum going.
Direct the governance system; Plan the governance system; Build the governance system; Run the governance system; Monitor the governance system.

question: In which stage of the Governance System Design Workflow would an enterprise consider the current I&T-related issues?
options: Determine the initial scope of the governance system

question: In which step of the Governance System Design Workflow would you resolve inherent priority conflicts?
options: Step 2, Determine the initial scope of the governance system
Step 4, Conclude the governance system design

question: When developing a business case, which of the following is an applicable reference when deriving challenges and success factors?
What is the best description of the alignment between the COBIT Implementation and Design Guides?
options: They both require all Governance and Management objectives to be assessed at a high maturity level.
Both approaches have seven steps, and each of those steps aligns with each other.
The COBIT Design Guide primarily aligns with the first three phases of the implementation lifecycle.

question: In which phase of the implementation lifecycle would an enterprise "Define the Road Map" for the implementation?
options: Phase 3, Where do we want to be?

question: The Implementation lifecycle has three perspectives, or rings. Which of the following is the correct description of these?
options: Portfolio Management, Program Management, Project Management
Program Management, Change Enablement, Continual Improvement
Initiate program, establish desire to change, recognize need to act

question: In Phase 1 of the Implementation lifecycle, a _________ is identified as an internal or external event, condition or key issue that serves as a stimulus for change.
During phase 7 of the Implementation lifecycle, which of the following tasks would be part of Change Enablement?
Phase _________ of the Implementation lifecycle sets a target for improvement followed by a gap analysis to identify potential solutions.
options: 3, Where do we want to be?

question: An enterprise will often fail to realize implementation commitments during the execution of an EGIT implementation program plan if it:
options: leverages existing mechanisms and ways of working.
reduces projects into smaller executable pieces.
focuses on enabling IT value over business value.

question: Which of the following is an important desired outcome to be achieved from the execution of an EGIT implementation program plan?
options: Completion of EGIT project implementation regardless of the amount of time required
Transition of EGIT projects into the enterprise's normal development life cycle
Development of a record of unapproved EGIT projects
Mitigation of all risks associated with the implementation of EGIT projects

question: The alignment goal titled "Enabling and supporting business processes by integrating applications and technology" is aligned to which IT balanced scorecard (BSC) dimension?
Which of the following is an enterprise goal according to COBIT?
Ensuring the program team knows and understands the enterprise goals is a part of which of the following implementation phases?
options: Where do we want to be?

question: Which of the following management objectives would be given HIGHER priority in an enterprise's governance system when the enterprise is very risk-averse?
Which of the following stakeholders ensures the business case and program plan are realistic and achievable?

An enterprise has been consistently growing over the years and has decided to adapt the COBIT framework from the growth perspective of the balanced scorecard dimensions. Which of the following enterprise goals is MOST relevant to select?
What is the BEST way for senior leadership to communicate its expectations for IT governance prior to commencing a governance implementation plan?
options: Include a scope statement in the business case.
Add key performance indicators (KPIs) to a balanced scorecard.

question: Which I&T-related issues should be considered as part of the design factors for a governance system in order to manage
options: risks that have a high probability.
risks that have a high impact.

question: Which of the following components should be considered for inclusion when considering the threat landscape design factor?
Which of the following l&T implementation methods requites the HIGHEST level of participation by users at multiple stages of software development?
Which of the following inputs MUST be defined before the planning for a new governance framework can be finalized?
Which of the following is a KEY consideration when finalizing a governance system design with competing priorities?
options: The enterprise should defer final design decisions to executive management to minimize conflicts among business stakeholders.
The enterprise should ensure all steps in the proposed workflow are applied when focusing on a very specific issue or initiative.
The enterprise should refer to the COBIT design workflow for universally applicable guidelines to resolve conflicting priorities.
The enterprise should be prepared to deviate from previously identified priorities with justified reasons.

question: A CIO of a global enterprise has been mandated by the board to change the IT organizational structure from a divisional model to a centralized model and adopt outsourcing as required. The CIO identifies specific design factors that increase the importance of certain governance and management objectives. Which of the following is MOST likely to increase as a result?
